Add in a matching lampshade and a set of scatter cushions to create a theme that welcomes you in without overpowering your senses.

The blind comes with sleek, modern aluminium framework which is also available in a white colour. products.title: Oasis, Charcoal - Roman Blind
products.description: The oasis charcoal is a beautiful hybrid of abstract patterning and colourful foliage. Mauves and blues meet alongside rich charcoal, surrounded by a cool off-white tone. The blind has an ethereal quality that would look stunning in both contemporary or period homes. Make a feature of the charcoal by placing it against a wall in the palest of greys. Furnish the room in medium woods, dusky blues, and muted mauves, being sure to add in plenty of plush fabrics for extra comfort and style.

products.title: Accents Stone Roman Blind
products.description: Light, creamy and warm, this soft and stylish roman blind is just the ticket for comforting, homely space. The sumptuous cream fabric is richly woven and softly textured, a light and bright shade with all the brightness of a white and all the warmth of a beige. The narrow borde light, creamy and warm, this soft and stylish roman blind is just the ticket for comforting, homely space.

products.title: Roland Monochrome Roman Blind
products.description: There's something crisp yet comforting about this roland monochrome roman blind, the soft neutral body perfectly decorated with lustrous silver borders. The contrast between soft cream and shimmering metallics is simply beautiful, unfussy yet full of character and luxury.

products.title: Origin, Grey - Vista Blind
products.description: Origin grey brings a modern light stone grey into your home and combines it with the clean and clear lines that only a contemporary vista blind can provide. Finely woven and expertly crafted, no matter how discerning your eye is you are guaranteed to appreciate the workmanship that goes into every square inch. The ability to give your room the perfect light levels all day long makes your kitchen a fantastic choice for origin grey.

products.title: Origin, Taupe - Vista Blind
products.description: A light beige fabric sits harmoniously below a matching voile to create the latest addition to their range of vista blinds. Lightweight and elegantly poised, every square inch is crafted with care to ensure that you add nothing but understated luxury to your home. If you want to give your home a touch of rustic country with a modern twist there is no better addition to make to your home than origin taupe.

products.title: Pavillion, Grey - Roman Blind
products.description: Keep up with the latest home dcor trends by including the pavillion in grey in your home. The fashionable grey and yellow colour pairing is both stylish and fun, and offers a serene look without compromising on colour. Hang the grey in your home study for a serious yet interesting look and feel. Opt for pale grey walls and accent throughout with charcoal greys and mustard yellows. Frame yellow and grey wall art in black, and go for modern, sleek furniture.

products.title: Africa (Blackout), Shadow - Roller Blind
products.description: There's nothing more awe-inspiring than standing back and immersing yourself in the intricacy of the tribal stylings of their new africa blackout shadow fabric. It gives any space your heart desires an added layer of depth and clarity, and it even has the splash of colour that can be so hard to integrate. Match shadow to some tribal themed wall art and you'll be able to turn the master bedroom into the homely and inspiring space that you love to relax in at the end of a long day.

products.title: Seaside (Blackout), Stone - Roller Blind
products.description: The beauty of seaside blackout stone is that it allows you to get lost in the moment like no other contemporary patterned fabric we know of. Just what you need when you want to create the light and homely space you never want to leave. Use blackout stone in the kitchen to add a contemporary touch of style that will allow you to get truly creative. By matching it to the tiling and flooring you'll be able to create a secondary layer that compliments the kitchen units and worktops that so often dominate the heart of the home.
